Instance.description: A Super Interaction that throws a carried object at a distance from the Sim.

TunableTuple.name: bounce_jig
TunableTuple.description: The jig to use for the object's bounce, where actor b is the object's final resting position, and actor a is where the initial bounce occurs, relative to the final position. The actor offsets will setup the distance of the bounce. If the offsets are both 0, then there will be no bounce. The offset for actor a will determine where the first bounce occurs.

TunableVariant.name: minimum_requirement_jig
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, we will use a jig to guarantee that we find a place to throw the ball from. From there, we find the furthest throw.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The jig to use so we can find a good place to start our throw from. Doesn't really matter which actor A and B are, as long as there is enough distance between them for a throw. After we place this jig, we FGL from that location to find the longest throw possible.
